intro: Maytenus shuangjianensis, commonly known as the Shuangjian mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its woody structure and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
